defaultPosition.description:
â¢ Solicitation, administration, close-out, negotiation, and termination of purchase orders, task orders, delivery orders, inter-agency agreements, blanket purchase orders, and contracts showcasing cradle to grave contracting 
â¢ Purchasing and/or managing a variety of service contracts including information technology (IT) support services and financial management services
â¢ Serving as a business advisor to a wide range of customers and advising customers of the pertinent program data required to successfully procure professional services and/or equipment
â¢ Assist Information Technologies Division to provide procurement services for Automated Information Systems (AIS), approved IT services requirements, and PBX phone systems
â¢ Reviewing requisitions to determine that proper specification or purchase descriptions are included in solicitation documents
â¢ Interpreting and applying laws, regulations, policies and procedures relevant to contracting and detention issues to include performance based national detention standards, Services Contract Act and the Davis Bacon Act
â¢ Evaluating bids or proposals for compliance with specifications or purchase descriptions and applicable clauses
â¢ Planning and carrying out pre-award, post-award, price/cost analysis, and other related staff functions in a relatively standardized or controlled work situation using established contracting procedures
â¢ Assisting managers and program offices in defining their acquisition needs and sources for obtaining them
â¢ Developing sources for supplying goods and/or services, identifying specifications, conducting market reviews and preparing analysis of prices/costs or services or products
â¢ Performing a wide range of contracting methods and contract types to plan and carry out pre-award and post-award procurement actions

positions.title: Contract Specialist

positions.description:
â¢ Provided top-level support to sales and client account management teams in a fast-paced/high volume environment, contributing significant business value through timely and high quality contract creation and negotiations.
â¢ Drafted, negotiated, edited, reviewed and administered a variety of complex documents, including Vendor Agreements, Independent Contractor Agreements, Business Associate Agreements, Consent Letters, Letters of Agreement, Amendments, and Addenda.
â¢ Advised and supported the sales and client account management departments in the resolution of critical business and contracting related issues via situational evaluation and analysis of associated business risks.
â¢ Supported negotiations with prospective and existing clients by leading and participating in numerous conversations and exchanges in-person, via telephone or over email, communicating the companyâs positions on contractual terms, revising/editing proposals and contracts, and coordinating with internal stakeholders to prepare and refine the scopes of the services and related pricing for proposals and contracts.
â¢ Strategic partner to the Sales, Client Account Management, Delivery, and Finance departments to understand and ensure accuracy and consistency with the business and financial requirements and objectives in all contracts using extensive knowledge of business processes and products.
â¢ Assisted in the formulation and deployment of process innovation and improvements related to interdepartmental collaboration to create efficiencies.
â¢ Conducted various other ad hoc legal projects and duties, including matters related to team engagement, company compliance and data sharing agreement review, as needed.
positions.title: Senior Contract Specialist, Legal Administration, Legal and Business Affairs

positions.description:
Masco's Installation and Services Business, including Masco Contractor Services and Services Partners became an independent publicly traded company in July 2015. Masco Contractor Services business now operates under TruTeam. The parent company, TopBuild, is comprised of over 190 TruTeam installation branch locations and over 70 Service Partners distribution centers across the U.S.

â¢ Reviewed, negotiated, proposed, processed or modified contracts to identify nonconformity and ensure compliance with company guidelines via evaluation of company risk matrix for identification and evaluation.
â¢ Was responsible for a portion of review of government contracts, owner contracts, and Prime agreements 
â¢ Evaluated and reduced business risk exposure for all internal sub divisions by preparing addendums to bring contracts into compliance with the Masco Contract Control Policy in addition to the risk matrix.  
â¢ Procured insurance certificates through brokers according to contractual obligations, including those related to FAR.
â¢ Liaised with internal team members and external clients as well as collaborated with Legal and Executive representatives regarding client contract creation to meet requirements and needs for all stakeholders. 
â¢ Assisted in creating a new team structure and process to streamline processes and increase efficiency including but not limited to working with outside counsel from various states, writing policy and procedure, creating training guides and leading internal training sessions, as well as providing feedback to executives. 
â¢ Appointed by the CFO to serve on a committee to communicate with the employees around information involving Masco Contractor Services going public in July 2015
